titleStmt.title: Iames by the grace of God, King of England, Scotland, France, and Ireland, defender of the faith, &c. To our right trustie and right welbeloued cousin, William Earle of Northampton, president of our councell within the dominion, principalitie, and marches of Wales, greeting ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)

titleStmt.title: Iames by the grace of God, King of England, Scotland, France, and Ireland, defender of the faith, &c. To our right trustie and right welbeloued cousin, William Earle of Northampton, president of our councell within the dominion, principalitie, and marches of Wales, greeting ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Bonham Norton and John Bill,

notesStmt.note: Appointing William Compton, Earl of Northampton as Lieutenant of Wales and the Marches.
The first sheet is oblong. The second sheet (not seen by cataloguers) is a letter from Northampton with blanks for the deputy's name.
Dated at end: Westminster the sixteenth day of Iune, in the two and twentieth yeere of our raigne ..
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
